IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: ROSECRANCE PROVIDES HELP, HOPE, AND RECOVERY TO CHILDREN, YOUTH, ADULTS, AND FAMILIES. ROSECRANCE FOUNDATION ENSURES PHILANTHROPIC RESOURCES ARE AVAILABLE TO MEET DESIGNATED NEEDS.
IRS990.MissionDesc: ROSECRANCE PROVIDES HELP, HOPE, AND RECOVERY TO CHILDREN, YOUTH, ADULTS, AND FAMILIES. ROSECRANCE FOUNDATION ENSURES PHILANTHROPIC RESOURCES ARE AVAILABLE TO MEET DESIGNATED NEEDS.
IRS990.Desc: RAISED FUNDS FOR ROSECRANCE, INC. TO PROVIDE BEHAVIORAL HEALTH CARE TREATMENT.

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE A, PART I, LINE 12G, COLUMN III:
Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.ExplanationTxt: ROSECRANCE HEALTH NETWORK IS A PUBLICLY SUPPORTED ORGANIZATION DEEMED TO BE A SECTION 509(A)(2) ORGANIZATION FOR PURPOSES OF SECTION 509(A)(3) UNDER THE PROVISIONS OF SECTION 509(A).

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ENDOWMENT FUNDS EXIST TO PROVIDE ONGOING FINANCIAL STABILITY FOR THE FOUNDATION TO SUPPORT CHARITY CARE NEEDS, NEW PROGRAMMING AND ONGOING SUPPORT FOR MENTAL HEALTH AND SUBSTANCE ABUSE PREVENTION, EARLY INTERVENTION, TREATMENT AND EDUCATION.

THE FOUNDATION QUALIFIES AS AN EXEMPT ORGANIZATION UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE AND HAS BEEN CLASSIFIED AS OTHER THAN A PRIVATE FOUNDATION AND, ACCORDINGLY, IS NOT SUBJECT TO INCOME TAXES ON RELATED INCOME UNDER CURRENT INCOME TAX LAW. THE FOUNDATION ACCOUNTS FOR UNCERTAINTY IN INCOME TAXES UNDER THE AUTHORITATIVE GUIDANCE ISSUED BY FINANCIAL ACCOUNTING STANDARDS BOARD ("FASB"). THE FOUNDATION USES A THRESHOLD OF MORE-LIKELY-THAN-NOT TO BE SUSTAINED UPON EXAMINATION TO ACCOUNT FOR UNCERTAINTY IN INCOME TAXES. MEASUREMENT OF THE TAX UNCERTAINTY OCCURS IF THE RECOGNITION THRESHOLD HAS NOT BEEN MET. THIS GUIDANCE ALSO ADDRESSES DERECOGNITION, CLASSIFICATION, INTEREST AND PENALTIES, DISCLOSURE, AND TRANSITION. THE FOUNDATION CONDUCTS BUSINESS SOLELY IN THE U.S. AND, AS A RESULT, FILES FEDERAL TAX RETURNS. IN THE NORMAL COURSE OF BUSINESS THE FOUNDATION IS SUBJECT TO EXAMINATION BY TAXING AUTHORITIES. THE FOUNDATION'S TAX RETURNS FOR YEARS SUBSEQUENT TO 2013 ARE OPEN, BY STATUTE, FOR REVIEW BY AUTHORITIES. HOWEVER, AT PRESENT, THERE ARE NO ONGOING INCOME TAX AUDITS OR UNRESOLVED DISPUTES WITH THE TAX AUTHORITIES THAT THE FOUNDATION CURRENTLY FILES OR HAS FILED WITH. AS OF JUNE 30, 2018 AND 2017, THE FOUNDATION HAD NO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS.
CHANGE IN VALUE OF CHARITABLE LEAD TRUST 6,382. FUNDRAISING EXPENSE 223,659.
THE GRANTS ARE MADE TO SUPPORT THE WORK OF RELATED ORGANIZATIONS. UPDATES ARE PROVIDED TO THE FOUNDATION'S BOARD OF DIRECTORS AT THEIR REGULARLY SCHEDULED MEETINGS.

THE CEO WAS PAID BY A RELATED ORGANIZATION, ROSECRANCE HEALTH NETWORK. THE CEO'S COMPENSATION WAS DETERMINED USING SALARY DATA FOR SIMILARLY QUALIFIED PERSONS IN FUNCTIONALLY COMPARABLE POSITIONS AT OTHER NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS. THE COMPENSATION DATA WAS OBTAINED FROM SURVEYS CONDUCTED BY INDEPENDENT THIRD PARTIES. THE CEO COMPENSATION PACKAGE WAS NEGOTIATED AND APPROVED BY THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. THE ACTIONS TO APPROVE THE COMPENSATION FOR THE CEO ARE RECORDED IN THE OFFICIAL MINUTES OF THE ORGANIZATION. THE COMPENSATION FOR KEY EMPLOYEES IS DETERMINED USING SALARY DATA FOR SIMILAR QUALIFIED PERSONS IN FUNCTIONALLY COMPARABLE POSITIONS AT OTHER NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS. THE COMPENSATION DATA WAS OBTAINED FROM SURVEYS CONDUCTED BY INDEPENDENT THIRD PARTIES. COPIES OF THE COMPENSATION STUDIES ARE MAINTAINED BY THE ORGANIZATION'S HUMAN RESOURCES DEPARTMENT.

THE ORGANIZATION'S CEO PARTICIPATES IN A NON-QUALIFIED DEFERRED COMPENSATION PLAN. CONTRIBUTIONS FOR CALENDAR YEAR 2017 WERE 75,000. MR. PHILIP W. EATON, MS - DEFERRED COMPENSATION PAYOUT MR. EATON HAS BEEN EMPLOYED BY ROSECRANCE HEALTH NETWORK (ROSECRANCE) SINCE 1971. HE HAS LED ROSECRANCE SINCE 1982 IN THE TOP EXECUTIVE POSITION. MR. EATON'S LEADERSHIP HELPED GROW ROSECRANCE TO SERVE MORE THAN 38,000 ADOLESCENTS AND ADULTS ANNUALLY. UNDER HIS DIRECTION, ROSECRANCE HAS BECOME THE STATE'S MOST COMPREHENSIVE NETWORK OF BEHAVIORAL HEALTH SERVICES. MR. EATON'S MANAGEMENT AND VISION HAS HAD AND WILL CONTINUE TO HAVE LASTING EFFECTS ON ROSECRANCE AND THE COMMUNITY FOR YEARS TO COME. THE DEFERRED COMPENSATION PLAN WAS ESTABLISHED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS TO PROVIDE AN INCENTIVE FOR KEY EMPLOYEES BY DEFERRING A PORTION OF THE INDIVIDUAL'S COMPENSATION UNTIL CERTAIN KEY PROVISIONS WERE MET. ANNUAL AMOUNTS RELATED TO THIS RETIREMENT BENEFIT WERE ACCRUED AND REPORTED IN PRIOR YEARS ON THE FORM 990 AS DEFERRED COMPENSATION. DURING THE FISCAL YEAR ENDED JUNE 30, 2018, A PAYMENT WAS MADE TO MR. EATON IN THE AMOUNT OF $350,251.95. THIS PAYMENT WAS MADE UPON THE ACCOMPLISHMENT OF THE KEY CRITERIA AS REQUIRED BY THE DEFERRED COMPENSATION PLAN.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 3
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ROSECRANCE FOUNDATION HAS DELEGATED MANAGEMENT DUTIES TO ROSECRANCE HEALTH NETWORK (RHN), THE SOLE CORPORATE MEMBER, UNDER A MANAGEMENT AGREEMENT.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ROSECRANCE FOUNDATION HAS A SOLE CORPORATE MEMBER, ROSECRANCE HEALTH NETWORK.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ROSECRANCE HEALTH NETWORK, THE SOLE CORPORATE MEMBER, HAS THE POWER TO APPOINT AND REMOVE THE GOVERNING BODY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ROSECRANCE HEALTH NETWORK HAS THE POWER TO ADOPT THE ARTICLES OF INCORPORATION AND BYLAWS. THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS OF ROSECRANCE FOUNDATION, INC. SHALL BE ENTITLED TO MAKE RECOMMENDATIONS REGARDING SUCH AMENDMENTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE CFO REVIEWS THE 990 WITH THE FINANCE COMMITTEE AT A FINANCE COMMITTEE MEETING. THE HEAD OF THE FINANCE COMMITTEE PRESENTS THE 990 TO THE FULL BOARD AT THE NEXT FULL BOARD MEETING FOR THEIR REVIEW AND APPROVAL BEFORE IT IS FILED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS, THE CEO AND KEY EMPLOYEES ARE REQUIRED ANNUALLY TO COMPLETE A CONFLICT OF INTEREST DISCLOSURE STATEMENT WITH THE CORPORATION. THE COMPLETED STATEMENTS ARE REVIEWED BY THE BOARD OR COMMITTEE. IF IT IS DETERMINED THAT A CONFLICT EXISTS, THAT MEMBER SHALL NOT PARTICIPATE IN DISCUSSION OR VOTING ON THE MATTER THAT RELATES TO THE CONFLICT. GENERAL COUNSEL ON AN ANNUAL BASIS PROVIDES INSTRUCTION TO THE BOARD ON WHAT CONSTITUTES A POTENTIAL CONFLICT. NEW MEMBERS ARE REQUIRED TO DISCLOSE POTENTIAL CONFLICTS AS PART OF HIS/HER ORIENTATION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE CEO WAS PAID BY A RELATED ORGANIZATION, ROSECRANCE HEALTH NETWORK. THE CEO'S COMPENSATION WAS DETERMINED USING SALARY DATA FOR SIMILARLY QUALIFIED PERSONS IN FUNCTIONALLY COMPARABLE POSITIONS AT OTHER NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS. THE COMPENSATION DATA WAS OBTAINED FROM SURVEYS CONDUCTED BY INDEPENDENT THIRD PARTIES. THE CEO COMPENSATION PACKAGE WAS NEGOTIATED AND APPROVED BY THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. THE ACTIONS TO APPROVE THE COMPENSATION FOR THE CEO ARE RECORDED IN THE OFFICIAL MINUTES OF THE ORGANIZATION. THE COMPENSATION FOR KEY EMPLOYEES IS DETERMINED USING SALARY DATA FOR SIMILAR QUALIFIED PERSONS IN FUNCTIONALLY COMPARABLE POSITIONS AT OTHER NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS. THE COMPENSATION DATA WAS OBTAINED FROM SURVEYS CONDUCTED BY INDEPENDENT THIRD PARTIES. COPIES OF THE COMPENSATION STUDIES ARE MAINTAINED BY THE ORGANIZATION'S HUMAN RESOURCES DEPARTMENT.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: COPIES OF THE GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE TO THE GENERAL PUBLIC UPON WRITTEN REQUEST.
CHANGE IN VALUE OF CHARITABLE LEAD TRUST 6,382.
THE ORGANIZATION HAS A COMMITTEE THAT ASSUMES RESPONSIBILITY FOR OVERSIGHT OF THE AUDIT; THE PROCESS HAS NOT CHANGED FROM THE PRIOR YEAR.
